Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Goblet
Description: Small oval-shaped vase, with a short neck and a barely noticeable lip, of a brown-red colour. The vessel was made from a coarse clay that contained an organic temper, significant traces of which are visible on the surface. The surface has been polished, but imperfectly evened out. The excavator classified this vessel as a goblet. Throwing marks are visible on the exterior surface.
